item.title: June 2013 Calgary, Alberta floods yycflood
item.description: Flooding of the Bow and Elbow Rivers inundated downtown Calgary, Alberta on June 21, 2013. Flooding and flash flooding has affected large parts of southern Alberta, due in part to a slow-moving storm front that is dumping a lot of rain on the area, up to 7.5 inches in 2.5 days. Three people have died from the flooding. If you're in Calgary, Alberta reading this, you should know that it's likely to be out of date and incomplete.
